segment.source: MD Conversion - Custom URI settings for Windows 10
segment.target: MD Conversion - Custom URI settings for Windows 10

segment.source: MD Conversion - Custom URI settings for Windows 10
segment.target: MD Conversion - Custom URI settings for Windows 10

segment.source: This topic lists the settings that you can configure for Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile devices in a Windows 10 Custom Policy.
segment.target: This topic lists the settings that you can configure for Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile devices in a Windows 10 Custom Policy.

segment.source: For information about how to create and deploy these policies, see Windows 10 custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For information about how to create and deploy these policies, see Windows 10 custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: In the Supports column of the following table, the following values are used:
segment.target: In the Supports column of the following table, the following values are used:

segment.source: Desktop – The setting supports Windows 10 Professional and Enterprise computers that are enrolled with only.
segment.target: Desktop – The setting supports Windows 10 Professional and Enterprise computers that are enrolled with only.

segment.source: Mobile – The setting supports Windows 10 Mobile devices only.
segment.target: Mobile – The setting supports Windows 10 Mobile devices only.

segment.source: Both – The setting supports both desktop and mobile devices.
segment.target: Both – The setting supports both desktop and mobile devices.

segment.source: All devices must be enrolled with if you want to use the Windows Custom URI Policy.
segment.target: All devices must be enrolled with if you want to use the Windows Custom URI Policy.

segment.source: 0 - user is not able to set the password grace period timer, and the value is set as “each time”
segment.target: 0 - user is not able to set the password grace period timer, and the value is set as “each time”

segment.source: 1 - user is able to set the password grace period timer
segment.target: 1 - user is able to set the password grace period timer

segment.source: 0 – Do not allow use Wi-Fi connection.
segment.target: 0 – Do not allow use Wi-Fi connection.

segment.source: 0 – No Wi-Fi connection outside of MDM provisioned is allowed.
segment.target: 0 – No Wi-Fi connection outside of MDM provisioned is allowed.

segment.source: 1 – Adding new network SSIDs beyond the already MDM provisioned ones is allowed.
segment.target: 1 – Adding new network SSIDs beyond the already MDM provisioned ones is allowed.

segment.source: 0 - VPN is not allowed over cellular
segment.target: 0 - VPN is not allowed over cellular

segment.source: 1 – VPN could use any connection including cellular.
segment.target: 1 – VPN could use any connection including cellular.

segment.source: 1 (not supported in Windows Phone 8.1) – Disable Bluetooth, but allow the configuration of hands-free profiles (value 1 isn’t supported in Windows Phone 8.1 for MDM and EAS.2 – allow Bluetooth)
segment.target: 1 (not supported in Windows Phone 8.1) – Disable Bluetooth, but allow the configuration of hands-free profiles (value 1 isn’t supported in Windows Phone 8.1 for MDM and EAS.2 – allow Bluetooth)

segment.source: Open Extended Dictionary is turned off.
segment.target: Open Extended Dictionary is turned off.

segment.source: Add a new Open Extended Dictionary
segment.target: Add a new Open Extended Dictionary

segment.source: Add a new search integration configuration file
segment.target: Add a new search integration configuration file

segment.source: An Open Extended Dictionary that was added before enabling this policy setting is not used for conversion.
segment.target: An Open Extended Dictionary that was added before enabling this policy setting is not used for conversion.

segment.source: A search integration configuration file that was installed before enabling this policy setting is not used.
segment.target: A search integration configuration file that was installed before enabling this policy setting is not used.

segment.source: Open Extended Dictionary can be added and used by default.
segment.target: Open Extended Dictionary can be added and used by default.

segment.source: Also, the search integration function can be used by default.
segment.target: Also, the search integration function can be used by default.

segment.source: Auto-tuned data and input history data is not saved to a file.
segment.target: Auto-tuned data and input history data is not saved to a file.

segment.source: Auto-tuned data and input history data is saved to a file.
segment.target: Auto-tuned data and input history data is saved to a file.

segment.source: 0 - All Except JIS characters are filtered
segment.target: 0 - All Except JIS characters are filtered

segment.source: 0 - All except JIS0208 characters are filtered
segment.target: 0 - All except JIS0208 characters are filtered

segment.source: 0 - All except JIS0208 characters or EUDC characters are filtered
segment.target: 0 - All except JIS0208 characters or EUDC characters are filtered

segment.source: 0 – Strict, highest filtering against adult content
segment.target: 0 – Strict, highest filtering against adult content

segment.source: 1 – Moderate, moderate filtering against adult content (valid search results will not be filtered)
segment.target: 1 – Moderate, moderate filtering against adult content (valid search results will not be filtered)

segment.source: 0: do not defer upgrade (stay in current branch, CB)
segment.target: 0: do not defer upgrade (stay in current branch, CB)

segment.source: 1: Enable updates and upgrades to be deferred (Device follows current branch for business, CBB, rules)
segment.target: 1: Enable updates and upgrades to be deferred (Device follows current branch for business, CBB, rules)

segment.source: Description: Policy to defer software updates for up to 4 weeks
segment.target: Description: Policy to defer software updates for up to 4 weeks

segment.source: Allowed values: 0: Apply updates immediately; 1-4: number of weeks to defer software updates.
segment.target: Allowed values: 0: Apply updates immediately; 1-4: number of weeks to defer software updates.

segment.source: Description: Policy to defer feature upgrades for up to 8 months
segment.target: Description: Policy to defer feature upgrades for up to 8 months

segment.source: Allowed values: 0: Apply updates immediately; 1-8: number of months to defer feature upgrades.
segment.target: Allowed values: 0: Apply updates immediately; 1-8: number of months to defer feature upgrades.

segment.source: Description: Allows a CBB machine to stop receiving updates and upgrades for 5 weeks.
segment.target: Description: Allows a CBB machine to stop receiving updates and upgrades for 5 weeks.

segment.source: This should be used in case there is an issue with an update.
segment.target: This should be used in case there is an issue with an update.

segment.source: 1-5: number of weeks to pause software updates and upgrades
segment.target: 1-5: number of weeks to pause software updates and upgrades

segment.source: Allowed values:0 - 90 – Represents what how long malware will be retained
segment.target: Allowed values:0 - 90 – Represents what how long malware will be retained

segment.source: Default value: 0 – keeps in the quarantine folder forever, and doesn’t automatically remove
segment.target: Default value: 0 – keeps in the quarantine folder forever, and doesn’t automatically remove

segment.source: Default value: 1 – Also runs when RTP is on when it is set to allowed
segment.target: Default value: 1 – Also runs when RTP is on when it is set to allowed

segment.source: 0 – Do not check for signatures on an interval
segment.target: 0 – Do not check for signatures on an interval

segment.source: 2 – Check for signatures every 2 hours, etc.
segment.target: 2 – Check for signatures every 2 hours, etc.

segment.source: Default value: 8 – Check for signatures every 8 hours
segment.target: Default value: 8 – Check for signatures every 8 hours

segment.source: <list of extensions separated by semi-colon> E.g.
segment.target: <list of extensions separated by semi-colon> E.g.

segment.source: Default value: No paths are excluded
segment.target: Default value: No paths are excluded

segment.source: Default value: No processes are excluded
segment.target: Default value: No processes are excluded

segment.source: Allowed values:0: browsing turned off; 1: browsing turned on.
segment.target: Allowed values:0: browsing turned off; 1: browsing turned on.

segment.source: Allowed values:0: Don't show search suggestions; 1: Show search suggestions.
segment.target: Allowed values:0: Don't show search suggestions; 1: Show search suggestions.

segment.source: Allowed values:0: Disabled (open intranet sites in Edge browser); 1 - Enabled (open intranet sites in Internet Explorer).
segment.target: Allowed values:0: Disabled (open intranet sites in Edge browser); 1 - Enabled (open intranet sites in Internet Explorer).

segment.source: Allowed values:0 – Disabled (DNT not sent); 1 – Enabled (send DNT)
segment.target: Allowed values:0 – Disabled (DNT not sent); 1 – Enabled (send DNT)

segment.source: Allowed values:0 – Do not allow; 1 – Allow
segment.target: Allowed values:0 – Do not allow; 1 – Allow

segment.source: Allowed values:0 – Block pop-ups; 1 – Allow pop-ups
segment.target: Allowed values:0 – Block pop-ups; 1 – Allow pop-ups

segment.source: Allow cookies from all web sites; 1 – Block only third party cookies; 2 – Block all cookies
segment.target: Allow cookies from all web sites; 1 – Block only third party cookies; 2 – Block all cookies

segment.source: Allowed values:0 – Password manager is disabled;
segment.target: Allowed values:0 – Password manager is disabled;

segment.source: Allowed values:0 – Not configured; 1 – Use IE’s enterprise mode site list if configured; 2 – Specify location to enterprise site list
segment.target: Allowed values:0 – Not configured; 1 – Use IE’s enterprise mode site list if configured; 2 – Specify location to enterprise site list

segment.source: Windows 10 custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Windows 10 custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune
